Calculate basal (or resting) metabolism as a function of mass and body temperature.

Source: R/energybalance_functions.R
Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp.Rd

estimate basal (or resting) metabolic rate (W) as a function of mass (g) and temperature (K). Based on empirical data and the metabolic theory of ecology (3/4 scaling exponent). Reference: Gillooly JF et al. 2001. Effects of size and temperature on metabolic rate. Science 293: 2248-2251.

Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp(m, T_b, taxa)

Arguments

m

Mass in grams.
T_b

body temperature in K
taxa

Which taxa. options: bird, mammal, reptile, amphibian, invertebrate.

Value

basal metabolim (W)

See also

Other biophysical models: Free_or_forced_convection(), Grashof_number_Gates(), Grashof_number(), Nu_from_Gr(), Nu_from_Re(), Nusselt_number(), Prandtl_number(), Qconduction_animal(), Qconduction_substrate(), Qconvection(), Qemitted_thermal_radiation(), Qevaporation(), Qmetabolism_from_mass(), Qnet_Gates(), Qradiation_absorbed(), Qthermal_radiation_absorbed(), Reynolds_number(), Tb_CampbellNorman(), Tb_Fei(), Tb_Gates2(), Tb_Gates(), Tb_butterfly(), Tb_grasshopper(), Tb_limpetBH(), Tb_limpet(), Tb_lizard(), Tb_mussel(), Tb_salamander_humid(), Tb_snail(), Tbed_mussel(), Tsoil(), actual_vapor_pressure(), boundary_layer_resistance(), external_resistance_to_water_vapor_transfer(), heat_transfer_coefficient_approximation(), heat_transfer_coefficient_simple(), heat_transfer_coefficient(), saturation_vapor_pressure(), saturation_water_vapor_pressure()

Examples

Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp(m=100, T_b=303, "reptile")

#> [1] 0.06282736
